description: The `LLM Agent Orchestration & Tools` subsystem is central to the project's AI interpretation layer, encapsulating the core logic for LLM agents, their interaction with LLMs, and the integration of specialized tools for various analytical tasks. It serves as the intelligent processing unit that interprets and acts upon code analysis results, defined by its core agent framework and specialized agents that perform distinct analytical functions such as detailed code analysis, validation, and diff analysis.

components.name: Agent Core
components.description: Provides the foundational structure and central orchestration logic for all specialized LLM agents, defining the common interface and workflow for agents to interact with LLMs and utilize various tools.

components.name: Agent Tooling
components.description: Manages the collection and integration of specialized tools that LLM agents can invoke to perform specific tasks, such as code analysis, data retrieval, or external API interactions. It ensures agents have access to the necessary functionalities.

components.name: Details Analysis Agent
components.description: A specialized agent responsible for conducting in-depth analysis of code components, extracting granular details, and providing comprehensive insights based on LLM interpretation.

components.name: Validation Agent
components.description: A specialized agent focused on validating identified components, references, and architectural patterns against predefined rules or best practices, ensuring the accuracy and consistency of the analysis.

components.name: Diff Analysis Agent
components.description: A specialized agent designed to perform comparative analysis between different versions of code or architectural states, identifying changes, their impact, and generating insights on evolution.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
